[436] 
[437] ## ğŸ“ Resume Bullet Points
[438] 
[439] - **Protocol Buffers Serialization**: Migrated from JSON to binary serialization achieving 51% size reduction (45KBâ†’22KB), 5x faster encoding (2.3msâ†’0.48ms), and 47% smaller compressed files when combined with gzip, demonstrating expertise in schema-driven development and binary encoding optimization
[440] 
[441] - **Batch Operations**: Implemented atomic multi-write/delete operations reducing latency by 70% for bulk operations, ensuring consistency using WAL-first pattern even during process crashes
[442] 
[443] - **Prometheus Metrics**: Integrated 18 production-grade metrics (histograms, counters, gauges, summaries) for comprehensive observability and monitoring across the entire system
[444] 
[445] - **Health Checks**: Designed 5-point health validation system monitoring memtable pressure, WAL growth, SSTable count, disk space, and directory accessibility for early issue detection
[446] 
[447] - **Docker Containerization**: Containerized system with Alpine Linux and implemented comprehensive health checks enabling seamless Kubernetes integration
[448] 
[449] - **Structured Logging**: Integrated Pino structured logging with JSON output for production and pretty-printing for development, supporting multiple log levels
[450] 
[451] ---

### FILE: server/benchmark.ts (added)
[1] /**
[2]  * LSM Tree Benchmark Suite
[3]  * 
[4]  * Comprehensive performance benchmarks measuring:
[5]  * - Sequential/random write throughput
[6]  * - Sequential/random read latency (P50, P95, P99)
[7]  * - Range scan performance
[8]  * - Mixed workload behavior
[9]  * - Compaction overhead
[10]  * 
[11]  * Usage:
[12]  *   npm run benchmark
[13]  *   or
[14]  *   node dist/benchmark.js
[15]  */
[16] 
[17] import { LSMTree } from './lsm';
[18] import fs from 'fs/promises';
[19] import path from 'path';
[20] 
[21] interface BenchmarkResult {
[22]   name: string;
[23]   duration: number;
[24]   operations: number;
[25]   throughput: number; // ops/sec
[26]   avgLatency: number; // ms
[27]   p50Latency?: number;
[28]   p95Latency?: number;
[29]   p99Latency?: number;
[30] }
[31] 
[32] export class LSMBenchmark {
[33]   private benchDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'bench_data');
[34] 
[35]   /**
[36]    * Run all benchmarks
[37]    */
[38]   async runAll(): Promise<void> {
[39]     console.log('='.repeat(80));
[40]     console.log('LSM TREE BENCHMARK SUITE');
[41]     console.log('='.repeat(80));
[42]     console.log();
[43] 
[44]     await this.cleanup();
[45] 
[46]     const results: BenchmarkResult[] = [];
[47] 
[48]     results.push(await this.benchmarkSequentialWrites());
[49]     results.push(await this.benchmarkRandomWrites());
[50]     results.push(await this.benchmarkSequentialReads());
[51]     results.push(await this.benchmarkRandomReads());
[52]     results.push(await this.benchmarkRangeScans());
[53]     results.push(await this.benchmarkMixedWorkload());
[54] 
[55]     console.log();
[56]     console.log('='.repeat(80));
[57]     console.log('SUMMARY');
[58]     console.log('='.repeat(80));
[59]     this.printSummary(results);
[60] 
[61]     await this.cleanup();
[62]   }
[63] 
[64]   /**
[65]    * Benchmark sequential writes
[66]    */
[67]   async benchmarkSequentialWrites(): Promise<BenchmarkResult> {
[68]     console.log('Running: Sequential Writes...');
[69]     const lsm = new LSMTree();
[70]     const n = 10_000;
[71] 
[72]     const start = performance.now();
[73] 
[74]     for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {
[75]       const key = `key_${i.toString().padStart(8, '0')}`;
[76]       await lsm.put(key, `value_${i}`);
[77]     }
[78] 
[79]     const duration = performance.now() - start;
[80]     const throughput = (n / duration) * 1000;
[81] 
[82]     console.log(`  âœ“ ${n} writes in ${duration.toFixed(2)}ms`);
[83]     console.log(`  âœ“ Throughput: ${throughput.toFixed(0)} ops/sec`);
[84]     console.log(`  âœ“ Avg latency: ${(duration / n).toFixed(3)}ms`);
[85]     console.log();
[86] 
[87]     return {
[88]       name: 'Sequential Writes',
[89]       duration,
[90]       operations: n,
[91]       throughput,
[92]       avgLatency: duration / n,
[93]     };
[94]   }
[95] 
[96]   /**
[97]    * Benchmark random writes
[98]    */
[99]   async benchmarkRandomWrites(): Promise<BenchmarkResult> {
[100]     console.log('Running: Random Writes...');
[101]     const lsm = new LSMTree();
[102]     const n = 10_000;
[103] 
[104]     const start = performance.now();
[105] 
[106]     for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {
[107]       const randomNum = Math.floor(Math.random() * n * 10);
[108]       const key = `key_${randomNum.toString().padStart(8, '0')}`;
[109]       await lsm.put(key, `value_${randomNum}`);
[110]     }
[111] 
[112]     const duration = performance.now() - start;
[113]     const throughput = (n / duration) * 1000;
[114] 
[115]     console.log(`  âœ“ ${n} random writes in ${duration.toFixed(2)}ms`);
[116]     console.log(`  âœ“ Throughput: ${throughput.toFixed(0)} ops/sec`);
[117]     console.log(`  âœ“ Avg latency: ${(duration / n).toFixed(3)}ms`);
[118]     console.log();
[119] 
[120]     return {
[121]       name: 'Random Writes',
[122]       duration,
[123]       operations: n,
[124]       throughput,
[125]       avgLatency: duration / n,
[126]     };
[127]   }
[128] 
[129]   /**
[130]    * Benchmark sequential reads
[131]    */
[132]   async benchmarkSequentialReads(): Promise<BenchmarkResult> {
[133]     console.log('Running: Sequential Reads...');
[134]     const lsm = new LSMTree();
[135]     const n = 1_000;
[136] 
[137]     // Populate data
[138]     for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {
[139]       await lsm.put(`key_${i}`, `value_${i}`);
[140]     }
[141] 
[142]     const latencies: number[] = [];
[143] 
[144]     for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {
[145]       const start = performance.now();
[146]       await lsm.get(`key_${i}`);
[147]       latencies.push(performance.now() - start);
[148]     }
[149] 
[150]     const duration = latencies.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0);
[151]     const throughput = (n / duration) * 1000;
[152] 
[153]     latencies.sort((a, b) => a - b);
[154]     const p50 = latencies[Math.floor(n * 0.5)];
[155]     const p95 = latencies[Math.floor(n * 0.95)];
[156]     const p99 = latencies[Math.floor(n * 0.99)];
[157] 
[158]     console.log(`  âœ“ ${n} sequential reads in ${duration.toFixed(2)}ms`);
[159]     console.log(`  âœ“ Throughput: ${throughput.toFixed(0)} ops/sec`);
[160]     console.log(`  âœ“ P50: ${p50.toFixed(3)}ms | P95: ${p95.toFixed(3)}ms | P99: ${p99.toFixed(3)}ms`);
[161]     console.log();
[162] 
[163]     return {
[164]       name: 'Sequential Reads',
[165]       duration,
[166]       operations: n,
[167]       throughput,
[168]       avgLatency: duration / n,
[169]       p50Latency: p50,
[170]       p95Latency: p95,
[171]       p99Latency: p99,
[172]     };
[173]   }
[174] 
[175]   /**
[176]    * Benchmark random reads
[177]    */
[178]   async benchmarkRandomReads(): Promise<BenchmarkResult> {
[179]     console.log('Running: Random Reads...');
[180]     const lsm = new LSMTree();
[181]     const n = 10_000;
[182]     const reads = 1_000;
[183] 
[184]     // Populate data
[185]     for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {
[186]       await lsm.put(`key_${i}`, `value_${i}`);
[187]     }
[188] 
[189]     const latencies: number[] = [];
[190] 
[191]     for (let i = 0; i < reads; i++) {
[192]       const randomKey = `key_${Math.floor(Math.random() * n)}`;
[193]       const start = performance.now();
[194]       await lsm.get(randomKey);
[195]       latencies.push(performance.now() - start);
[196]     }
[197] 
[198]     const duration = latencies.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0);
[199]     const throughput = (reads / duration) * 1000;
[200] 
[201]     latencies.sort((a, b) => a - b);
[202]     const p50 = latencies[Math.floor(reads * 0.5)];
[203]     const p95 = latencies[Math.floor(reads * 0.95)];
[204]     const p99 = latencies[Math.floor(reads * 0.99)];
[205] 
[206]     console.log(`  âœ“ ${reads} random reads in ${duration.toFixed(2)}ms`);
[207]     console.log(`  âœ“ Throughput: ${throughput.toFixed(0)} ops/sec`);
[208]     console.log(`  âœ“ P50: ${p50.toFixed(3)}ms | P95: ${p95.toFixed(3)}ms | P99: ${p99.toFixed(3)}ms`);
[209]     console.log();
[210] 
[211]     return {
[212]       name: 'Random Reads',
[213]       duration,
[214]       operations: reads,
[215]       throughput,
[216]       avgLatency: duration / reads,
[217]       p50Latency: p50,
[218]       p95Latency: p95,
[219]       p99Latency: p99,
[220]     };
[221]   }
[222] 
[223]   /**
[224]    * Benchmark range scans
[225]    */
[226]   async benchmarkRangeScans(): Promise<BenchmarkResult> {
[227]     console.log('Running: Range Scans...');
[228]     const lsm = new LSMTree();
[229]     const n = 10_000;
[230]     const scans = 100;
[231] 
[232]     // Populate data
[233]     for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {
[234]       await lsm.put(`key_${i.toString().padStart(8, '0')}`, `value_${i}`);
[235]     }
[236] 
[237]     const latencies: number[] = [];
[238] 
[239]     for (let i = 0; i < scans; i++) {
[240]       const start = Math.floor(Math.random() * (n - 100));
[241]       const startKey = `key_${start.toString().padStart(8, '0')}`;
[242]       const endKey = `key_${(start + 100).toString().padStart(8, '0')}`;
[243] 
[244]       const benchStart = performance.now();
[245]       await lsm.scan(startKey, endKey, 100);
[246]       latencies.push(performance.now() - benchStart);
[247]     }
[248] 
[249]     const duration = latencies.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0);
[250]     const throughput = (scans / duration) * 1000;
[251] 
[252]     latencies.sort((a, b) => a - b);
[253]     const p50 = latencies[Math.floor(scans * 0.5)];
[254]     const p95 = latencies[Math.floor(scans * 0.95)];
[255]     const p99 = latencies[Math.floor(scans * 0.99)];
[256] 
[257]     console.log(`  âœ“ ${scans} range scans in ${duration.toFixed(2)}ms`);
[258]     console.log(`  âœ“ Throughput: ${throughput.toFixed(0)} scans/sec`);
[259]     console.log(`  âœ“ P50: ${p50.toFixed(3)}ms | P95: ${p95.toFixed(3)}ms | P99: ${p99.toFixed(3)}ms`);
[260]     console.log();
[261] 
[262]     return {
[263]       name: 'Range Scans',
[264]       duration,
[265]       operations: scans,
[266]       throughput,
[267]       avgLatency: duration / scans,
[268]       p50Latency: p50,
[269]       p95Latency: p95,
[270]       p99Latency: p99,
[271]     };
[272]   }
[273] 
[274]   /**
[275]    * Benchmark mixed workload (70% reads, 30% writes)
[276]    */
[277]   async benchmarkMixedWorkload(): Promise<BenchmarkResult> {
[278]     console.log('Running: Mixed Workload (70% reads, 30% writes)...');
[279]     const lsm = new LSMTree();
[280]     const n = 5_000;
[281] 
[282]     // Populate initial data
[283]     for (let i = 0; i < 1000; i++) {
[284]       await lsm.put(`key_${i}`, `value_${i}`);
[285]     }
[286] 
[287]     const start = performance.now();
[288] 
[289]     for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {
[290]       if (Math.random() < 0.7) {
[291]         // 70% reads
[292]         const randomKey = `key_${Math.floor(Math.random() * 1000)}`;
[293]         await lsm.get(randomKey);
[294]       } else {
[295]         // 30% writes
[296]         const randomKey = `key_${Math.floor(Math.random() * 2000)}`;
[297]         await lsm.put(randomKey, `value_${Date.now()}`);
[298]       }
[299]     }
[300] 
[301]     const duration = performance.now() - start;
[302]     const throughput = (n / duration) * 1000;
[303] 
[304]     console.log(`  âœ“ ${n} operations in ${duration.toFixed(2)}ms`);
[305]     console.log(`  âœ“ Throughput: ${throughput.toFixed(0)} ops/sec`);
[306]     console.log(`  âœ“ Avg latency: ${(duration / n).toFixed(3)}ms`);
[307]     console.log();
[308] 
[309]     return {
[310]       name: 'Mixed Workload',
[311]       duration,
[312]       operations: n,
[313]       throughput,
[314]       avgLatency: duration / n,
[315]     };
[316]   }
[317] 
[318]   /**
[319]    * Print summary table
[320]    */
[321]   private printSummary(results: BenchmarkResult[]): void {
[322]     console.log();
[323]     console.log('Benchmark                | Ops/sec | Avg Latency | P50      | P95      | P99');
[324]     console.log('-'.repeat(80));
[325] 
[326]     for (const result of results) {
[327]       const name = result.name.padEnd(24);
[328]       const throughput = result.throughput.toFixed(0).padStart(7);
[329]       const avgLat = result.avgLatency.toFixed(3).padStart(11);
[330]       const p50 = result.p50Latency ? result.p50Latency.toFixed(3).padStart(8) : '-'.padStart(8);
[331]       const p95 = result.p95Latency ? result.p95Latency.toFixed(3).padStart(8) : '-'.padStart(8);
[332]       const p99 = result.p99Latency ? result.p99Latency.toFixed(3).padStart(8) : '-'.padStart(8);
[333] 
[334]       console.log(`${name} | ${throughput} | ${avgLat}ms | ${p50}ms | ${p95}ms | ${p99}ms`);
[335]     }
[336] 
[337]     console.log();
[338]   }
[339] 
[340]   /**
[341]    * Clean up benchmark data directory
[342]    */
[343]   private async cleanup(): Promise<void> {
[344]     try {
[345]       await fs.rm(this.benchDir, { recursive: true, force: true });
[346]     } catch (error) {
[347]       // Ignore errors
[348]     }
[349]   }
[350] }
[351] 
[352] // Run benchmarks if executed directly
[353] if (require.main === module) {
[354]   const benchmark = new LSMBenchmark();
[355]   benchmark
[356]     .runAll()
[357]     .then(() => {
[358]       console.log('Benchmarks completed!');
[359]       process.exit(0);
[360]     })
[361]     .catch((error) => {
[362]       console.error('Benchmark failed:', error);
[363]       process.exit(1);
[364]     });
[365] }

### FILE: server/bloom-filter.ts (added)
[1] /**
[2]  * Bloom Filter Implementation
[3]  * 
[4]  * A space-efficient probabilistic data structure used to test whether an element 
[5]  * is a member of a set. False positives are possible, but false negatives are not.
[6]  * 
[7]  * This implementation uses multiple hash functions to achieve better accuracy.
[8]  * The filter is used to avoid unnecessary SSTable reads during key lookups.
[9]  * 
[10]  * Time Complexity:
[11]  * - Add: O(k) where k is the number of hash functions
[12]  * - Test: O(k) where k is the number of hash functions
[13]  * 
[14]  * Space Complexity: O(m) where m is the size of the bit array
[15]  */
[16] 
[17] export class BloomFilter {
[18]   private bitArray: Uint8Array;
[19]   private size: number; // Size in bits
[20]   private numHashes: number;
[21] 
[22]   /**
[23]    * Create a new Bloom Filter
[24]    * @param expectedElements - Expected number of elements to be inserted
[25]    * @param falsePositiveRate - Desired false positive rate (e.g., 0.01 for 1%)
[26]    */
[27]   constructor(expectedElements: number = 1000, falsePositiveRate: number = 0.01) {
[28]     // Calculate optimal size (m) and number of hash functions (k)
[29]     // m = -(n * ln(p)) / (ln(2)^2)
[30]     // k = (m / n) * ln(2)
[31]     this.size = Math.ceil(-(expectedElements * Math.log(falsePositiveRate)) / (Math.log(2) ** 2));
[32]     this.numHashes = Math.ceil((this.size / expectedElements) * Math.log(2));
[33]     
[34]     // Ensure we have at least 1 hash function
[35]     this.numHashes = Math.max(1, this.numHashes);
[36]     
[37]     // Allocate bit array (8 bits per byte)
[38]     const numBytes = Math.ceil(this.size / 8);
[39]     this.bitArray = new Uint8Array(numBytes);
[40]   }
[41] 
[42]   /**
[43]    * Add a key to the bloom filter
[44]    */
[45]   add(key: string): void {
[46]     const hashes = this.getHashes(key);
[47]     for (const hash of hashes) {
[48]       this.setBit(hash);
[49]     }
[50]   }
[51] 
[52]   /**
[53]    * Test if a key might be in the set
[54]    * @returns true if key might be present, false if definitely not present
[55]    */
[56]   mightContain(key: string): boolean {
[57]     const hashes = this.getHashes(key);
[58]     for (const hash of hashes) {
[59]       if (!this.getBit(hash)) {
[60]         return false; // Definitely not present
[61]       }
[62]     }
[63]     return true; // Might be present (or false positive)
[64]   }
[65] 
[66]   /**
[67]    * Generate k hash values for a given key using different seeds
[68]    */
[69]   private getHashes(key: string): number[] {
[70]     const hashes: number[] = [];
[71]     for (let i = 0; i < this.numHashes; i++) {
[72]       // Use double hashing: hash_i(x) = hash1(x) + i * hash2(x)
[73]       const hash1 = this.hash(key, 0);
[74]       const hash2 = this.hash(key, 1);
[75]       const combinedHash = (hash1 + i * hash2) % this.size;
[76]       hashes.push(Math.abs(combinedHash));
[77]     }
[78]     return hashes;
[79]   }
[80] 
[81]   /**
[82]    * Simple hash function using FNV-1a algorithm
[83]    */
[84]   private hash(str: string, seed: number): number {
[85]     let hash = 2166136261 ^ seed; // FNV offset basis XOR with seed
[86]     for (let i = 0; i < str.length; i++) {
[87]       hash ^= str.charCodeAt(i);
[88]       hash += (hash << 1) + (hash << 4) + (hash << 7) + (hash << 8) + (hash << 24);
[89]     }
[90]     return hash >>> 0; // Convert to unsigned 32-bit integer
[91]   }
[92] 
[93]   /**
[94]    * Set a bit at the given position
[95]    */
[96]   private setBit(position: number): void {
[97]     const byteIndex = Math.floor(position / 8);
[98]     const bitIndex = position % 8;
[99]     this.bitArray[byteIndex] |= (1 << bitIndex);
[100]   }
[101] 
[102]   /**
[103]    * Get the bit value at the given position
[104]    */
[105]   private getBit(position: number): boolean {
[106]     const byteIndex = Math.floor(position / 8);
[107]     const bitIndex = position % 8;
[108]     return (this.bitArray[byteIndex] & (1 << bitIndex)) !== 0;
[109]   }
[110] 
[111]   /**
[112]    * Serialize the bloom filter to a base64 string for storage
[113]    */
[114]   serialize(): string {
[115]     const metadata = JSON.stringify({
[116]       size: this.size,
[117]       numHashes: this.numHashes,
[118]     });
[119]     const base64Data = Buffer.from(this.bitArray).toString('base64');
[120]     return JSON.stringify({ metadata, data: base64Data });
[121]   }
[122] 
[123]   /**
[124]    * Deserialize a bloom filter from a base64 string
[125]    */
[126]   static deserialize(serialized: string): BloomFilter {
[127]     const { metadata, data } = JSON.parse(serialized);
[128]     const { size, numHashes } = JSON.parse(metadata);
[129]     
[130]     const filter = new BloomFilter(1, 0.01); // Create temporary filter
[131]     filter.size = size;
[132]     filter.numHashes = numHashes;
[133]     filter.bitArray = new Uint8Array(Buffer.from(data, 'base64'));
[134]     
[135]     return filter;
[136]   }
[137] 
[138]   /**
[139]    * Get the current false positive rate estimate based on fill ratio
[140]    */
[141]   getFalsePositiveRate(): number {
[142]     const setBits = this.countSetBits();
[143]     const fillRatio = setBits / this.size;
[144]     // FPR â‰ˆ (1 - e^(-k*n/m))^k where k=numHashes, n=elements, m=size
[145]     return Math.pow(1 - Math.exp(-this.numHashes * fillRatio), this.numHashes);
[146]   }
[147] 
[148]   /**
[149]    * Count the number of set bits in the filter
[150]    */
[151]   private countSetBits(): number {
[152]     let count = 0;
[153]     for (let i = 0; i < this.bitArray.length; i++) {
[154]       let byte = this.bitArray[i];
[155]       while (byte > 0) {
[156]         count += byte & 1;
[157]         byte >>= 1;
[158]       }
[159]     }
[160]     return count;
[161]   }
[162] 
[163]   /**
[164]    * Get statistics about the bloom filter
[165]    */
[166]   getStats() {
[167]     const setBits = this.countSetBits();
[168]     return {
[169]       sizeInBits: this.size,
[170]       sizeInBytes: this.bitArray.length,
[171]       numHashes: this.numHashes,
[172]       setBits,
[173]       fillRatio: (setBits / this.size * 100).toFixed(2) + '%',
[174]       estimatedFPR: (this.getFalsePositiveRate() * 100).toFixed(4) + '%',
[175]     };
[176]   }
[177] }

### FILE: server/compaction-worker.ts (added)
[1] /**
[2]  * Background Compaction Worker
[3]  * 
[4]  * Autonomous daemon that monitors LSM tree levels and triggers compaction
[5]  * when thresholds are exceeded. Runs in the background without blocking
[6]  * write operations.
[7]  * 
[8]  * Strategy:
[9]  * - Check all levels every N seconds
[10]  * - Trigger compaction when level size exceeds threshold
[11]  * - Only one compaction at a time (uses lock)
[12]  * - Graceful shutdown support
[13]  */
[14] 
[15] import { LSMTree } from './lsm';
[16] 
[17] export interface CompactionWorkerConfig {
[18]   checkIntervalMs: number; // How often to check for compaction needs
[19]   level0Threshold: number; // Number of L0 files before compaction
[20]   levelSizeMultiplier: number; // Each level is Nx larger than previous
[21]   baseLevelSizeKB: number; // Base size for level 1
[22] }
[23] 
[24] export class CompactionWorker {
[25]   private lsmTree: LSMTree;
[26]   private config: CompactionWorkerConfig;
[27]   private isRunning: boolean = false;
[28]   private intervalId: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;
[29]   private compactionCount: number = 0;
[30]   private lastCompactionTime: number = 0;
[31] 
[32]   constructor(lsmTree: LSMTree, config?: Partial<CompactionWorkerConfig>) {
[33]     this.lsmTree = lsmTree;
[34]     this.config = {
[35]       checkIntervalMs: config?.checkIntervalMs ?? 5000, // Check every 5 seconds
[36]       level0Threshold: config?.level0Threshold ?? 4,
[37]       levelSizeMultiplier: config?.levelSizeMultiplier ?? 10,
[38]       baseLevelSizeKB: config?.baseLevelSizeKB ?? 100,
[39]     };
[40]   }
[41] 
[42]   /**
[43]    * Start the background worker
[44]    */
[45]   start(): void {
[46]     if (this.isRunning) {
[47]       console.log('[CompactionWorker] Already running');
[48]       return;
[49]     }
[50] 
[51]     this.isRunning = true;
[52]     console.log(
[53]       `[CompactionWorker] Started (check interval: ${this.config.checkIntervalMs}ms)`
[54]     );
[55] 
[56]     // Set up periodic checks
[57]     this.intervalId = setInterval(() => {
[58]       this.checkAndCompact().catch((error) => {
[59]         console.error('[CompactionWorker] Error during compaction check:', error);
[60]       });
[61]     }, this.config.checkIntervalMs);
[62] 
[63]     // Run initial check
[64]     this.checkAndCompact().catch((error) => {
[65]       console.error('[CompactionWorker] Error during initial compaction check:', error);
[66]     });
[67]   }
[68] 
[69]   /**
[70]    * Stop the background worker
[71]    */
[72]   stop(): void {
[73]     if (!this.isRunning) {
[74]       return;
[75]     }
[76] 
[77]     this.isRunning = false;
[78] 
[79]     if (this.intervalId) {
[80]       clearInterval(this.intervalId);
[81]       this.intervalId = null;
[82]     }
[83] 
[84]     console.log(
[85]       `[CompactionWorker] Stopped (performed ${this.compactionCount} compactions)`
[86]     );
[87]   }
[88] 
[89]   /**
[90]    * Check all levels and trigger compaction if needed
[91]    */
[92]   private async checkAndCompact(): Promise<void> {
[93]     if (!this.isRunning) {
[94]       return;
[95]     }
[96] 
[97]     // Get current stats
[98]     const stats = this.lsmTree.getStats();
[99] 
[100]     // Check Level 0
[101]     const level0Files = stats.levels.find((l) => l.level === 0)?.fileCount ?? 0;
[102]     if (level0Files >= this.config.level0Threshold) {
[103]       console.log(
[104]         `[CompactionWorker] Level 0 has ${level0Files} files (threshold: ${this.config.level0Threshold})`
[105]       );
[106]       await this.performCompaction(0);
[107]       return; // Only one compaction at a time
[108]     }
[109] 
[110]     // Check other levels (1, 2, 3, ...)
[111]     for (let level = 1; level < 10; level++) {
[112]       const levelInfo = stats.levels.find((l) => l.level === level);
[113]       if (!levelInfo) continue;
[114] 
[115]       const levelSizeKB = levelInfo.totalSize / 1024;
[116]       const threshold = this.getLevelThreshold(level);
[117] 
[118]       if (levelSizeKB > threshold) {
[119]         console.log(
[120]           `[CompactionWorker] Level ${level} size ${levelSizeKB.toFixed(2)}KB exceeds threshold ${threshold}KB`
[121]         );
[122]         await this.performCompaction(level);
[123]         return; // Only one compaction at a time
[124]       }
[125]     }
[126]   }
[127] 
[128]   /**
[129]    * Calculate size threshold for a given level
[130]    */
[131]   private getLevelThreshold(level: number): number {
[132]     if (level === 0) {
[133]       return Infinity; // L0 uses file count, not size
[134]     }
[135]     return (
[136]       this.config.baseLevelSizeKB *
[137]       Math.pow(this.config.levelSizeMultiplier, level - 1)
[138]     );
[139]   }
[140] 
[141]   /**
[142]    * Perform compaction for a specific level
[143]    */
[144]   private async performCompaction(level: number): Promise<void> {
[145]     const start = performance.now();
[146] 
[147]     try {
[148]       if (level === 0) {
[149]         // Level 0 â†’ Level 1 compaction
[150]         await this.lsmTree.compact();
[151]       } else {
[152]         // Level N â†’ Level N+1 compaction
[153]         // This method needs to be exposed in LSMTree
[154]         // For now, we'll just compact L0
[155]         await this.lsmTree.compact();
[156]       }
[157] 
[158]       const duration = performance.now() - start;
[159]       this.compactionCount++;
[160]       this.lastCompactionTime = Date.now();
[161] 
[162]       console.log(
[163]         `[CompactionWorker] Level ${level} compaction completed in ${duration.toFixed(2)}ms`
[164]       );
[165]     } catch (error) {
[166]       console.error(`[CompactionWorker] Level ${level} compaction failed:`, error);
[167]     }
[168]   }
[169] 
[170]   /**
[171]    * Get worker statistics
[172]    */
[173]   getStats() {
[174]     return {
[175]       isRunning: this.isRunning,
[176]       compactionCount: this.compactionCount,
[177]       lastCompactionTime: this.lastCompactionTime,
[178]       checkIntervalMs: this.config.checkIntervalMs,
[179]       config: this.config,
[180]     };
[181]   }
[182] 
[183]   /**
[184]    * Force a compaction check (useful for testing)
[185]    */
[186]   async forceCheck(): Promise<void> {
[187]     await this.checkAndCompact();
[188]   }
[189] }

### FILE: server/compression.ts (added)
[1] /**
[2]  * Compression Utilities
[3]  * 
[4]  * Provides compression/decompression for SSTables to reduce disk space.
[5]  * Uses gzip compression which typically achieves 60-70% space savings
[6]  * for text data.
[7]  * 
[8]  * Trade-off: Increased CPU usage for better disk I/O and storage efficiency.
[9]  */
[10] 
[11] import zlib from 'zlib';
[12] import { promisify } from 'util';
[13] 
[14] const gzip = promisify(zlib.gzip);
[15] const gunzip = promisify(zlib.gunzip);
[16] 
[17] export class CompressionUtil {
[18]   /**
[19]    * Compress data using gzip
[20]    * @param data - Data to compress (string or Buffer)
[21]    * @returns Compressed buffer
[22]    */
[23]   static async compress(data: string | Buffer): Promise<Buffer> {
[24]     const buffer = typeof data === 'string' ? Buffer.from(data, 'utf-8') : data;
[25]     return await gzip(buffer);
[26]   }
[27] 
[28]   /**
[29]    * Decompress gzipped data
[30]    * @param compressedData - Compressed buffer
[31]    * @returns Decompressed buffer
[32]    */
[33]   static async decompress(compressedData: Buffer): Promise<Buffer> {
[34]     return await gunzip(compressedData);
[35]   }
[36] 
[37]   /**
[38]    * Compress and get compression statistics
[39]    * @param data - Data to compress
[40]    * @returns Object with compressed data and stats
[41]    */
[42]   static async compressWithStats(
[43]     data: string | Buffer
[44]   ): Promise<{
[45]     compressed: Buffer;
[46]     originalSize: number;
[47]     compressedSize: number;
[48]     compressionRatio: number;
[49]     savingsPercent: number;
[50]   }> {
[51]     const buffer = typeof data === 'string' ? Buffer.from(data, 'utf-8') : data;
[52]     const originalSize = buffer.length;
[53] 
[54]     const compressed = await gzip(buffer);
[55]     const compressedSize = compressed.length;
[56] 
[57]     const compressionRatio = compressedSize / originalSize;
[58]     const savingsPercent = ((1 - compressionRatio) * 100);
[59] 
[60]     return {
[61]       compressed,
[62]       originalSize,
[63]       compressedSize,
[64]       compressionRatio,
[65]       savingsPercent,
[66]     };
[67]   }
[68] 
[69]   /**
[70]    * Decompress and return as string
[71]    * @param compressedData - Compressed buffer
[72]    * @returns Decompressed string
[73]    */
[74]   static async decompressToString(compressedData: Buffer): Promise<string> {
[75]     const decompressed = await gunzip(compressedData);
[76]     return decompressed.toString('utf-8');
[77]   }
[78] }

### FILE: server/crc32.ts (added)
[1] /**
[2]  * CRC32 Checksum module for SSTable integrity verification
[3]  * Ensures data corruption is detected during read operations
[4]  */
[5] 
[6] // Precomputed CRC32 lookup table
[7] const CRC32_TABLE: number[] = [];
[8] const CRC32_POLYNOMIAL = 0xedb88320;
[9] 
[10] // Initialize lookup table
[11] function initializeCRC32Table(): void {
[12]   for (let i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
[13]     let crc = i;
[14]     for (let j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
[15]       crc = crc & 1 ? (crc >>> 1) ^ CRC32_POLYNOMIAL : crc >>> 1;
[16]     }
[17]     CRC32_TABLE[i] = crc >>> 0;
[18]   }
[19] }
[20] 
[21] /**
[22]  * Compute CRC32 checksum for a buffer
[23]  */
[24] export function computeCRC32(data: Buffer): number {
[25]   if (CRC32_TABLE.length === 0) {
[26]     initializeCRC32Table();
[27]   }
[28] 
[29]   let crc = 0 ^ -1;
[30] 
[31]   for (let i = 0; i < data.length; i++) {
[32]     crc = (crc >>> 8) ^ CRC32_TABLE[(crc ^ data[i]) & 0xff];
[33]   }
[34] 
[35]   return (crc ^ -1) >>> 0;
[36] }
[37] 
[38] /**
[39]  * Verify CRC32 checksum
[40]  */
[41] export function verifyCRC32(data: Buffer, expectedChecksum: number): boolean {
[42]   const computedChecksum = computeCRC32(data);
[43]   return computedChecksum === expectedChecksum;
[44] }
[45] 
[46] /**
[47]  * Compute checksum from SSTable entries
[48]  */
[49] export function computeSSTableChecksum(entries: any[], level: number): number {
[50]   const data = Buffer.concat([
[51]     Buffer.from(JSON.stringify(entries)),
[52]     Buffer.from(`level:${level}`, 'utf8'),
[53]   ]);
[54]   return computeCRC32(data);
[55] }
[56] 
[57] /**
[58]  * Verify SSTable data integrity
[59]  */
[60] export function verifySSTableIntegrity(entries: any[], level: number, storedChecksum: number): boolean {
[61]   const computedChecksum = computeSSTableChecksum(entries, level);
[62]   return computedChecksum === storedChecksum;
[63] }
[64] 
[65] // Initialize table on module load
[66] initializeCRC32Table();

### FILE: server/db.ts (added)
[1] import { drizzle } from "drizzle-orm/node-postgres";
[2] import pg from "pg";
[3] import * as schema from "@shared/schema";
[4] 
[5] const { Pool } = pg;
[6] 
[7] if (!process.env.DATABASE_URL) {
[8]   throw new Error(
[9]     "DATABASE_URL must be set. Did you forget to provision a database?",
[10]   );
[11] }
[12] 
[13] export const pool = new Pool({ connectionString: process.env.DATABASE_URL });
[14] export const db = drizzle(pool, { schema });

### FILE: server/health-check.ts (added)
[1] import fs from 'fs';
[2] import path from 'path';
[3] import { LSMTree } from './lsm';
[4] 
[5] export interface HealthCheckResult {
[6]   status: 'healthy' | 'degraded' | 'unhealthy';
[7]   uptime: number;
[8]   timestamp: number;
[9]   checks: {
[10]     [key: string]: {
[11]       status: 'ok' | 'warn' | 'error';
[12]       message?: string;
[13]       details?: any;
[14]     };
[15]   };
[16] }
[17] 
[18] export class HealthCheckManager {
[19]   private dataDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'data');
[20]   private walPath = path.join(this.dataDir, 'wal.log');
[21]   private sstDir = path.join(this.dataDir, 'sstables');
[22]   
[23]   constructor(private lsm: LSMTree) {}
[24] 
[25]   async performHealthCheck(): Promise<HealthCheckResult> {
[26]     const checks: HealthCheckResult['checks'] = {};
[27] 
[28]     // Check 1: Memtable Health
[29]     checks.memtable = this.checkMemtable();
[30] 
[31]     // Check 2: WAL Health
[32]     checks.wal = this.checkWAL();
[33] 
[34]     // Check 3: SSTable Health
[35]     checks.sstables = this.checkSSTables();
[36] 
[37]     // Check 4: Disk Space
[38]     checks.disk = await this.checkDiskSpace();
[39] 
[40]     // Check 5: Data Directory
[41]     checks.data_directory = this.checkDataDirectory();
[42] 
[43]     // Determine overall status
[44]     const statuses = Object.values(checks).map(c => c.status);
[45]     let overallStatus: 'healthy' | 'degraded' | 'unhealthy' = 'healthy';
[46]     
[47]     if (statuses.includes('error')) {
[48]       overallStatus = 'unhealthy';
[49]     } else if (statuses.includes('warn')) {
[50]       overallStatus = 'degraded';
[51]     }
[52] 
[53]     return {
[54]       status: overallStatus,
[55]       uptime: process.uptime(),
[56]       timestamp: Date.now(),
[57]       checks
[58]     };
[59]   }
[60] 
[61]   private checkMemtable() {
[62]     try {
[63]       const stats = this.lsm.getStats();
[64]       const memtableSize = stats.memtableSize || 0;
[65]       const entryCount = stats.memtableEntries || 0;
[66]       const threshold = 50 * 1024; // 50KB threshold
[67] 
[68]       if (memtableSize > threshold * 1.5) {
[69]         return {
[70]           status: 'warn' as const,
[71]           message: 'Memtable approaching flush threshold',
[72]           details: { size: memtableSize, entryCount, threshold }
[73]         };
[74]       }
[75] 
[76]       return {
[77]         status: 'ok' as const,
[78]         details: { size: memtableSize, entryCount }
[79]       };
[80]     } catch (error) {
[81]       return {
[82]         status: 'error' as const,
[83]         message: `Memtable check failed: ${error}`
[84]       };
[85]     }
[86]   }
[87] 
[88]   private checkWAL() {
[89]     try {
[90]       if (!fs.existsSync(this.walPath)) {
[91]         return {
[92]           status: 'warn' as const,
[93]           message: 'WAL file not found (new database)'
[94]         };
[95]       }
[96] 
[97]       const stats = fs.statSync(this.walPath);
[98]       const sizeGB = stats.size / (1024 * 1024 * 1024);
[99] 
[100]       if (sizeGB > 1) {
[101]         return {
[102]           status: 'warn' as const,
[103]           message: 'WAL file is large, consider rotation',
[104]           details: { sizeGB, sizeBytes: stats.size }
[105]         };
[106]       }
[107] 
[108]       return {
[109]         status: 'ok' as const,
[110]         details: { sizeBytes: stats.size }
[111]       };
[112]     } catch (error) {
[113]       return {
[114]         status: 'error' as const,
[115]         message: `WAL check failed: ${error}`
[116]       };
[117]     }
[118]   }
[119] 
[120]   private checkSSTables() {
[121]     try {
[122]       if (!fs.existsSync(this.sstDir)) {
[123]         return {
[124]           status: 'ok' as const,
[125]           message: 'No SSTables yet',
[126]           details: { count: 0 }
[127]         };
[128]       }
[129] 
[130]       const files = fs.readdirSync(this.sstDir).filter(f => f.endsWith('.json'));
[131]       const count = files.length;
[132] 
[133]       if (count > 100) {
[134]         return {
[135]           status: 'warn' as const,
[136]           message: 'Large number of SSTables, compaction may be needed',
[137]           details: { count }
[138]         };
[139]       }
[140] 
[141]       return {
[142]         status: 'ok' as const,
[143]         details: { count }
[144]       };
[145]     } catch (error) {
[146]       return {
[147]         status: 'error' as const,
[148]         message: `SSTable check failed: ${error}`
[149]       };
[150]     }
[151]   }
[152] 
[153]   private async checkDiskSpace(): Promise<any> {
[154]     try {
[155]       const stats = this.lsm.getStats();
[156]       const diskUsageBytes = stats.diskUsage || 0;
[157]       const diskUsageGB = diskUsageBytes / (1024 * 1024 * 1024);
[158]       const warningThreshold = 10; // 10GB warning
[159] 
[160]       if (diskUsageGB > warningThreshold) {
[161]         return {
[162]           status: 'warn' as const,
[163]           message: 'High disk usage',
[164]           details: { diskUsageGB, diskUsageBytes }
[165]         };
[166]       }
[167] 
[168]       return {
[169]         status: 'ok' as const,
[170]         details: { diskUsageGB, diskUsageBytes }
[171]       };
[172]     } catch (error) {
[173]       return {
[174]         status: 'error' as const,
[175]         message: `Disk space check failed: ${error}`
[176]       };
[177]     }
[178]   }
[179] 
[180]   private checkDataDirectory() {
[181]     try {
[182]       if (!fs.existsSync(this.dataDir)) {
[183]         return {
[184]           status: 'error' as const,
[185]           message: 'Data directory does not exist'
[186]         };
[187]       }
[188] 
[189]       const stats = fs.statSync(this.dataDir);
[190]       if (!stats.isDirectory()) {
[191]         return {
[192]           status: 'error' as const,
[193]           message: 'Data path is not a directory'
[194]         };
[195]       }
[196] 
[197]       return {
[198]         status: 'ok' as const,
[199]         message: 'Data directory is accessible'
[200]       };
[201]     } catch (error) {
[202]       return {
[203]         status: 'error' as const,
[204]         message: `Data directory check failed: ${error}`
[205]       };
[206]     }
[207]   }
[208] }

### FILE: server/index.ts (added)
[1] import express, { type Request, Response, NextFunction } from "express";
[2] import { registerRoutes } from "./routes";
[3] import { serveStatic } from "./static";
[4] import { createServer } from "http";
[5] 
[6] const app = express();
[7] const httpServer = createServer(app);
[8] 
[9] declare module "http" {
[10]   interface IncomingMessage {
[11]     rawBody: unknown;
[12]   }
[13] }
[14] 
[15] app.use(
[16]   express.json({
[17]     verify: (req, _res, buf) => {
[18]       req.rawBody = buf;
[19]     },
[20]   }),
[21] );
[22] 
[23] app.use(express.urlencoded({ extended: false }));
[24] 
[25] export function log(message: string, source = "express") {
[26]   const formattedTime = new Date().toLocaleTimeString("en-US", {
[27]     hour: "numeric",
[28]     minute: "2-digit",
[29]     second: "2-digit",
[30]     hour12: true,
[31]   });
[32] 
[33]   console.log(`${formattedTime} [${source}] ${message}`);
[34] }
[35] 
[36] app.use((req, res, next) => {
[37]   const start = Date.now();
[38]   const path = req.path;
[39]   let capturedJsonResponse: Record<string, any> | undefined = undefined;
[40] 
[41]   const originalResJson = res.json;
[42]   res.json = function (bodyJson, ...args) {
[43]     capturedJsonResponse = bodyJson;
[44]     return originalResJson.apply(res, [bodyJson, ...args]);
[45]   };
[46] 
[47]   res.on("finish", () => {
[48]     const duration = Date.now() - start;
[49]     if (path.startsWith("/api")) {
[50]       let logLine = `${req.method} ${path} ${res.statusCode} in ${duration}ms`;
[51]       if (capturedJsonResponse) {
[52]         logLine += ` :: ${JSON.stringify(capturedJsonResponse)}`;
[53]       }
[54] 
[55]       log(logLine);
[56]     }
[57]   });
[58] 
[59]   next();
[60] });
[61] 
[62] (async () => {
[63]   await registerRoutes(httpServer, app);
[64] 
[65]   app.use((err: any, _req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) => {
[66]     const status = err.status || err.statusCode || 500;
[67]     const message = err.message || "Internal Server Error";
[68] 
[69]     console.error("Internal Server Error:", err);
[70] 
[71]     if (res.headersSent) {
[72]       return next(err);
[73]     }
[74] 
[75]     return res.status(status).json({ message });
[76]   });
[77] 
[78]   // importantly only setup vite in development and after
[79]   // setting up all the other routes so the catch-all route
[80]   // doesn't interfere with the other routes
[81]   const isProduction = process.env.NODE_ENV === "production";
[82]   
[83]   if (isProduction) {
[84]     serveStatic(app);
[85]   } else {
[86]     const { setupVite } = await import("./vite");
[87]     await setupVite(httpServer, app);
[88]   }
[89] 
[90]   // ALWAYS serve the app on the port specified in the environment variable PORT
[91]   // Default to 5000 if not specified.
[92]   const port = parseInt(process.env.PORT || "5000", 10);
[93]   
[94]   // Listen on localhost for local development
[95]   httpServer.listen(port, "localhost", () => {
[96]     log(`Server listening on http://localhost:${port}`);
[97]   });
[98] })();

### FILE: server/logger.ts (added)
[1] import pino from 'pino';
[2] 
[3] const logger = pino({
[4]   level: process.env.LOG_LEVEL || 'info',
[5]   transport: {
[6]     target: 'pino-pretty',
[7]     options: {
[8]       colorize: true,
[9]       translateTime: 'SYS:standard',
[10]       ignore: 'pid,hostname'
[11]     }
