### FILE: server/lsm.ts (added)
[1] import fs from 'fs';
[2] import path from 'path';
[3] import { KVPair } from '@shared/schema';
[4] import { BloomFilter } from './bloom-filter';
[5] import { SkipList } from './skip-list';
[6] import { Mutex } from 'async-mutex';
[7] import { CompressionUtil } from './compression';
[8] import { CompactionWorker } from './compaction-worker';
[9] import { metrics } from './metrics';
[10] 
[11] /**
[12]  * LSM Tree Storage Engine
[13]  * 
[14]  * A Log-Structured Merge (LSM) tree implementation featuring:
[15]  * - In-memory MemTable for fast writes
[16]  * - Write-Ahead Log (WAL) for durability
[17]  * - Multiple levels of SSTables with size-tiered compaction
[18]  * - Bloom filters for efficient key lookups
[19]  * - Sparse index blocks for range query optimization
[20]  * - Comprehensive error handling and recovery
[21]  * 
[22]  * Architecture:
[23]  * Level 0: Recently flushed SSTables (may have overlapping key ranges)
[24]  * Level 1+: Compacted SSTables with non-overlapping key ranges
[25]  * 
[26]  * Compaction Strategy:
[27]  * - Level 0 â†’ Level 1: Merge all L0 files when threshold reached
[28]  * - Level N â†’ Level N+1: Size-tiered compaction when level size exceeds limit
[29]  */
[30] 
[31] // === CONSTANTS ===
[32] const DATA_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), 'data');
[33] const WAL_PATH = path.join(DATA_DIR, 'wal.log');
[34] const SST_DIR = path.join(DATA_DIR, 'sstables');
[35] const BLOOM_DIR = path.join(DATA_DIR, 'blooms');
[36] const INDEX_DIR = path.join(DATA_DIR, 'indexes');
[37] 
[38] // Tuning parameters
[39] const MEMTABLE_THRESHOLD = 50; // Entries before flush
[40] const LEVEL_0_COMPACTION_THRESHOLD = 4; // Number of L0 files before compaction
[41] const LEVEL_SIZE_MULTIPLIER = 10; // Each level is 10x larger than previous
[42] const BASE_LEVEL_SIZE = 100; // Base size for level 1 in KB
[43] const SPARSE_INDEX_INTERVAL = 10; // Create index entry every N keys 
[44] 
[45] // Ensure directories exist with error handling
[46] try {
[47]   if (!fs.existsSync(DATA_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(DATA_DIR, { recursive: true });
[48]   if (!fs.existsSync(SST_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(SST_DIR, { recursive: true });
[49]   if (!fs.existsSync(BLOOM_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(BLOOM_DIR, { recursive: true });
[50]   if (!fs.existsSync(INDEX_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(INDEX_DIR, { recursive: true });
[51] } catch (error) {
[52]   console.error('Failed to create data directories:', error);
[53]   throw new Error('Storage engine initialization failed');
[54] }
[55] 
[56] /**
[57]  * Represents a single entry in the MemTable
[58]  */
[59] interface MemTableEntry {
[60]   value: string | null; // null represents a tombstone (deletion marker)
[61]   timestamp: number; // Timestamp for conflict resolution
[62] }
[63] 
[64] /**
[65]  * Metadata about an SSTable file
[66]  */
[67] interface SSTableMeta {
[68]   filename: string;
[69]   level: number;
[70]   minKey: string;
[71]   maxKey: string;
[72]   size: number; // Size in bytes
[73]   keyCount: number; // Number of keys in the SSTable
[74] }
[75] 
[76] /**
[77]  * Sparse index entry for fast range lookups
[78]  * Maps a key to its position in the SSTable
[79]  */
[80] interface SparseIndexEntry {
[81]   key: string;
[82]   offset: number; // Position in the data array
[83] }
[84] 
[85] /**
[86]  * Structure of an SSTable file on disk
[87]  */
[88] interface SSTableContent {
[89]   level: number;
[90]   minKey: string;
[91]   maxKey: string;
[92]   count: number;
[93]   data: { key: string; value: string | null }[];
[94]   sparseIndex?: SparseIndexEntry[]; // Optional sparse index for faster lookups
[95] }
[96] 
[97] 
[98] export class LSMTree {
[99]   // In-memory data structures
[100]   private memTable: SkipList<string, MemTableEntry> = new SkipList();
[101]   private bloomFilters: Map<string, BloomFilter> = new Map(); // filename -> BloomFilter
[102]   
[103]   // Concurrency control
[104]   private writeMutex = new Mutex();
[105]   
[106]   // Background workers
[107]   private compactionWorker: CompactionWorker;
[108]   
[109]   // State flags
[110]   private isCompacting = false;
[111]   
[112]   // Metrics and statistics
[113]   private totalWrites = 0;
[114]   private totalReads = 0;
[115]   private bloomFilterHits = 0; // Avoided SSTable reads
[116]   private bloomFilterMisses = 0; // Had to read SSTable
[117]   private writeLatencies: number[] = [];
[118]   private readLatencies: number[] = [];
[119]   private lastFlushDuration = 0;
[120]   private lastCompactionDuration = 0;
[121]   private writeAmplification = 1.0;
[122] 
[123]   constructor() {
[124]     try {
[125]       this.recoverFromWAL();
[126]       this.loadBloomFilters();
[127]       
[128]       // Initialize background compaction worker
[129]       this.compactionWorker = new CompactionWorker(this);
[130]       this.compactionWorker.start();
[131]       
[132]       console.log('LSM Tree initialized successfully with concurrent writes and background compaction');
[133]     } catch (error) {
[134]       console.error('Failed to initialize LSM Tree:', error);
[135]       throw error;
[136]     }
[137]   }
[138] 
[139]   /**
[140]    * Insert or update a key-value pair
[141]    * 
[142]    * Write path:
[143]    * 1. Acquire write lock for concurrency safety
[144]    * 2. Write to WAL for durability (crash recovery)
[145]    * 3. Insert into MemTable (Skip List) for fast access
[146]    * 4. Check if MemTable needs flushing
[147]    * 5. Record metrics
[148]    * 
[149]    * @throws Error if WAL write fails
[150]    */
[151]   public async put(key: string, value: string): Promise<void> {
[152]     const start = performance.now();
[153]     
[154]     // Acquire write lock for thread safety
[155]     const release = await this.writeMutex.acquire();
[156]     
[157]     try {
[158]       await this.writeToWAL(key, value);
[159]       this.memTable.insert(key, { value, timestamp: Date.now() });
[160]       await this.checkMemTableSize();
[161] 
[162]       this.totalWrites++;
[163]       const latency = performance.now() - start;
[164]       this.writeLatencies.push(latency);
[165]       metrics.recordPut(latency);
[166]       metrics.updateStorage(this.memTable.getSize(), this.getSSTableCount());
[167]     } catch (error) {
[168]       console.error('PUT operation failed:', error);
[169]       throw new Error(`Failed to PUT key="${key}": ${error}`);
[170]     } finally {
[171]       release();
[172]     }
[173]   }
[174] 
[175]   /**
[176]    * Delete a key by writing a tombstone marker
[177]    * 
[178]    * LSM trees use tombstones instead of immediate deletion.
[179]    * The actual deletion happens during compaction when tombstones are merged.
[180]    * 
[181]    * @throws Error if WAL write fails
[182]    */
[183]   public async delete(key: string): Promise<void> {
[184]     const start = performance.now();
[185]     
[186]     // Acquire write lock for thread safety
[187]     const release = await this.writeMutex.acquire();
[188]     
[189]     try {
[190]       await this.writeToWAL(key, null); // null = tombstone
[191]       this.memTable.insert(key, { value: null, timestamp: Date.now() });
[192]       await this.checkMemTableSize();
[193]       
[194]       const latency = performance.now() - start;
[195]       metrics.recordDelete(latency);
[196]     } catch (error) {
[197]       console.error(`Failed to delete key "${key}":`, error);
[198]       throw new Error(`Delete operation failed: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error'}`);
[199]     } finally {
[200]       release();
[201]     }
[202]   }
[203] 
[204]   /**
[205]    * Retrieve the value for a given key
[206]    * 
[207]    * Read path:
[208]    * 1. Check MemTable (most recent data)
[209]    * 2. Check Level 0 SSTables (newest to oldest)
[210]   /**
[211]    * Atomic batch PUT operations
[212]    * 
[213]    * Batch operations are atomic - either all succeed or all fail.
[214]    * All entries are written to WAL first, then inserted to memtable.
[215]    * This reduces lock contention compared to individual operations.
[216]    * 
[217]    * @param entries Array of {key, value} pairs to insert
[218]    * @throws Error if WAL write fails
[219]    */
[220]   public async batchPut(entries: Array<{key: string, value: string}>): Promise<void> {
[221]     const start = performance.now();
[222]     
[223]     if (!entries || entries.length === 0) {
[224]       throw new Error('Batch cannot be empty');
[225]     }
[226]     
[227]     const release = await this.writeMutex.acquire();
[228]     
[229]     try {
[230]       // Write all to WAL first (atomic)
[231]       for (const {key, value} of entries) {
[232]         await this.writeToWAL(key, value);
[233]       }
[234]       
[235]       // Then insert all to memtable
[236]       for (const {key, value} of entries) {
[237]         this.memTable.insert(key, {
[238]           value,
[239]           timestamp: Date.now(),
[240]           isTombstone: false
[241]         });
[242]       }
[243]       
[244]       this.totalWrites += entries.length;
[245]       await this.checkMemTableSize();
[246]       
[247]       const latency = performance.now() - start;
[248]       metrics.recordBatchPut(latency, entries.length);
[249]       metrics.updateStorage(this.memTable.getSize(), this.getSSTableCount());
[250]     } catch (error) {
[251]       console.error('Batch PUT operation failed:', error);
[252]       throw new Error(`Failed to batch PUT ${entries.length} entries: ${error}`);
[253]     } finally {
[254]       release();
[255]     }
[256]   }
[257] 
[258]   /**
[259]    * Atomic batch DELETE operations
[260]    * 
[261]    * Similar to batchPut but writes tombstones.
[262]    * 
[263]    * @param keys Array of keys to delete
[264]    * @throws Error if WAL write fails
[265]    */
[266]   public async batchDelete(keys: string[]): Promise<void> {
[267]     const start = performance.now();
[268]     
[269]     if (!keys || keys.length === 0) {
[270]       throw new Error('Batch cannot be empty');
[271]     }
[272]     
[273]     const release = await this.writeMutex.acquire();
[274]     
[275]     try {
[276]       // Write all tombstones to WAL first
[277]       for (const key of keys) {
[278]         await this.writeToWAL(key, null); // null = tombstone
[279]       }
[280]       
[281]       // Then insert all tombstones to memtable
[282]       for (const key of keys) {
[283]         this.memTable.insert(key, {
[284]           value: null,
[285]           timestamp: Date.now(),
[286]           isTombstone: true
[287]         });
[288]       }
[289]       
[290]       await this.checkMemTableSize();
[291]       
[292]       const latency = performance.now() - start;
[293]       metrics.recordBatchDelete(latency, keys.length);
[294]     } catch (error) {
[295]       console.error('Batch DELETE operation failed:', error);
[296]       throw new Error(`Failed to batch DELETE ${keys.length} keys: ${error}`);
[297]     } finally {
[298]       release();
[299]     }
[300]   }
[301] 
[302]   /**
[303]    * Retrieve the value for a given key
[304]    * 
[305]    * Read path:
[306]    * 1. Check MemTable (most recent data)
[307]    * 2. Check Level 0 SSTables (newest to oldest)
[308]    * 3. Check Level 1+ SSTables (with bloom filter optimization)
[309]    * 
[310]    * Bloom filters help skip SSTables that definitely don't contain the key.
[311]    * 
[312]    * @returns The value if found, null if not found or deleted
[313]    */
[314]   public async get(key: string): Promise<string | null> {
[315]     const start = performance.now();
[316]     let result = null;
[317]     
[318]     try {
[319]       // Step 1: Check MemTable first (most recent writes)
[320]       const memEntry = this.memTable.get(key);
[321]       if (memEntry !== null && memEntry !== undefined) {
[322]         result = memEntry.value;
[323]       } else {
[324]         // Step 2: Check SSTables from newest to oldest
[325]         const sstables = this.getSSTables();
[326]         
[327]         // Sort by level (L0 first) and timestamp (newest first within level)
[328]         const sortedSSTs = sstables.sort((a, b) => {
[329]           if (a.level !== b.level) return a.level - b.level;
[330]           const timeA = parseInt(a.filename.split('_')[2]);
[331]           const timeB = parseInt(b.filename.split('_')[2]);
[332]           return timeB - timeA; // Newest first
[333]         });
[334] 
[335]         // Search through SSTables
[336]         for (const sst of sortedSSTs) {
[337]           // Quick range check
[338]           if (key < sst.minKey || key > sst.maxKey) {
[339]             continue;
[340]           }
[341] 
[342]           // Bloom filter optimization: skip if definitely not present
[343]           const bloom = this.bloomFilters.get(sst.filename);
[344]           if (bloom && !bloom.mightContain(key)) {
[345]             this.bloomFilterHits++; // Successfully avoided disk read
[346]             metrics.recordBloomFilter(true);
[347]             continue;
[348]           }
[349] 
[350]           // Bloom filter says it might be present, or no bloom filter exists
[351]           if (bloom) {
[352]             this.bloomFilterMisses++; // Had to read despite bloom filter
[353]             metrics.recordBloomFilter(false);
[354]           }
[355] 
[356]           const data = await this.readSSTable(sst.filename);
[357]           const entry = data.find(d => d.key === key);
[358]           if (entry) {
[359]             result = entry.value;
[360]             break; // Found it, stop searching
[361]           }
[362]         }
[363]       }
[364] 
[365]       this.totalReads++;
[366]       const latency = performance.now() - start;
[367]       this.readLatencies.push(latency);
[368]       if (this.readLatencies.length > 1000) this.readLatencies.shift();
[369]       metrics.recordGet(latency);
[370]       
[371]       return result;
[372]     } catch (error) {
[373]       console.error(`Failed to get key "${key}":`, error);
[374]       throw new Error(`Read operation failed: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error'}`);
[375]     }
[376]   }
[377] 
[378]   /**
[379]    * Scan a range of keys
[380]    * 
[381]    * Merges data from MemTable and all relevant SSTables, returning keys in sorted order.
[382]    * Uses sparse indexes when available for faster range scans.
[383]    * Uses Skip List's efficient range() method for O(log n + k) performance.
[384]    * 
[385]    * @param startKey - Optional start of range (inclusive)
[386]    * @param endKey - Optional end of range (inclusive)
[387]    * @param limit - Maximum number of results to return
[388]    * @returns Array of key-value pairs in sorted order
[389]    */
[390]   public async scan(startKey?: string, endKey?: string, limit: number = 20): Promise<KVPair[]> {
[391]     const start = performance.now();
[392]     
[393]     try {
[394]       const mergedData = new Map<string, string | null>();
[395] 
[396]       // Use Skip List's efficient range query for MemTable
[397]       const memTableEntries = this.memTable.range(startKey, endKey);
[398]       for (const [k, v] of memTableEntries) {
[399]         mergedData.set(k, v.value);
[400]       }
[401] 
[402]       // Scan SSTables
[403]       const sstables = this.getSSTables();
[404]       for (const sst of sstables) {
[405]         // Skip SSTables outside the range
[406]         if (endKey && sst.minKey > endKey) continue;
[407]         if (startKey && sst.maxKey < startKey) continue;
[408] 
[409]         const data = await this.readSSTableRange(sst.filename, startKey, endKey);
[410]         for (const entry of data) {
[411]           if (!mergedData.has(entry.key)) {
[412]             mergedData.set(entry.key, entry.value);
[413]           }
[414]         }
[415]       }
[416] 
[417]       // Sort and filter keys (mergedData keys are already from sorted sources)
[418]       let keys = Array.from(mergedData.keys()).sort();
[419]       if (startKey) keys = keys.filter(k => k >= startKey);
[420]       if (endKey) keys = keys.filter(k => k <= endKey);
[421]       
[422]       // Build result set (exclude tombstones)
[423]       const result: KVPair[] = [];
[424]       for (const k of keys) {
[425]         const val = mergedData.get(k);
[426]         if (val !== null && val !== undefined) { // Skip tombstones and undefined
[427]           result.push({ key: k, value: val });
[428]         }
[429]         if (result.length >= limit) break;
[430]       }
[431]       
[432]       const latency = performance.now() - start;
[433]       metrics.recordScan(latency);
[434]       
[435]       return result;
[436]     } catch (error) {
[437]       console.error('Scan operation failed:', error);
[438]       throw new Error(`Scan operation failed: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error'}`);
[439]     }
[440]   }
[441] 
[442]   /**
[443]    * Get comprehensive statistics about the storage engine
[444]    */
[445]   public getStats() {
[446]     try {
[447]       const sstables = this.getSSTables();
[448]       const levels: Record<number, { count: number, size: number, files: string[] }> = {};
[449]       
[450]       sstables.forEach(sst => {
[451]         if (!levels[sst.level]) levels[sst.level] = { count: 0, size: 0, files: [] };
[452]         levels[sst.level].count++;
[453]         levels[sst.level].size += sst.size;
[454]         levels[sst.level].files.push(sst.filename);
[455]       });
[456] 
[457]       const avgWriteLat = this.writeLatencies.length > 0 
[458]         ? this.writeLatencies.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / this.writeLatencies.length 
[459]         : 0;
[460]       const avgReadLat = this.readLatencies.length > 0 
[461]         ? this.readLatencies.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / this.readLatencies.length 
[462]         : 0;
[463] 
[464]       // Calculate bloom filter efficiency
[465]       const totalBloomChecks = this.bloomFilterHits + this.bloomFilterMisses;
[466]       const bloomFilterEfficiency = totalBloomChecks > 0 
[467]         ? (this.bloomFilterHits / totalBloomChecks) * 100 
[468]         : 0;
[469] 
[470]       return {
[471]         memTableSize: this.memTable.getSize(),
[472]         walSize: fs.existsSync(WAL_PATH) ? fs.statSync(WAL_PATH).size : 0,
[473]         levels: Object.entries(levels).map(([lvl, stats]) => ({
[474]           level: parseInt(lvl),
[475]           fileCount: stats.count,
[476]           totalSize: stats.size,
[477]           files: stats.files
[478]         })),
[479]         isCompacting: this.isCompacting,
[480]         metrics: {
[481]           totalWrites: this.totalWrites,
[482]           totalReads: this.totalReads,
[483]           avgWriteLatencyMs: avgWriteLat,
[484]           avgReadLatencyMs: avgReadLat,
[485]           lastFlushDurationMs: this.lastFlushDuration,
[486]           lastCompactionDurationMs: this.lastCompactionDuration,
[487]           writeAmplification: this.writeAmplification,
[488]           bloomFilterHits: this.bloomFilterHits,
[489]           bloomFilterMisses: this.bloomFilterMisses,
[490]           bloomFilterEfficiency: bloomFilterEfficiency.toFixed(2) + '%'
[491]         }
[492]       };
[493]     } catch (error) {
[494]       console.error('Failed to get stats:', error);
[495]       return {
[496]         memTableSize: 0,
[497]         walSize: 0,
[498]         levels: [],
[499]         isCompacting: false,
[500]         metrics: {
[501]           totalWrites: 0,
[502]           totalReads: 0,
[503]           avgWriteLatencyMs: 0,
[504]           avgReadLatencyMs: 0,
[505]           lastFlushDurationMs: 0,
[506]           lastCompactionDurationMs: 0,
[507]           writeAmplification: 1.0,
[508]           bloomFilterHits: 0,
[509]           bloomFilterMisses: 0,
[510]           bloomFilterEfficiency: '0%'
[511]         }
[512]       };
[513]     }
[514]   }
[515] 
[516]   // ============================================================================
[517]   // PRIVATE HELPER METHODS
[518]   // ============================================================================
[519] 
[520]   /**
[521]    * Write an operation to the Write-Ahead Log for durability
[522]    * 
[523]    * The WAL ensures that writes are not lost in case of crash.
[524]    * On recovery, we replay the WAL to reconstruct the MemTable.
[525]    * 
[526]    * @throws Error if file write fails
[527]    */
[528]   private async writeToWAL(key: string, value: string | null): Promise<void> {
[529]     try {
[530]       const entry = JSON.stringify({ k: key, v: value, t: Date.now() }) + '\n';
[531]       await fs.promises.appendFile(WAL_PATH, entry, 'utf-8');
[532]     } catch (error) {
[533]       console.error('WAL write failed:', error);
[534]       throw new Error('Failed to write to WAL - data may not be durable');
[535]     }
[536]   }
[537] 
[538]   /**
[539]    * Recover the MemTable from WAL after a restart
[540]    * 
[541]    * This ensures durability: even if we crash, we can rebuild the MemTable
[542]    * from the WAL and not lose any writes.
[543]    */
[544]   private recoverFromWAL(): void {
[545]     try {
[546]       if (!fs.existsSync(WAL_PATH)) {
[547]         console.log('No WAL found, starting fresh');
[548]         return;
[549]       }
[550] 
[551]       const fileContent = fs.readFileSync(WAL_PATH, 'utf-8');
[552]       const lines = fileContent.split('\n').filter(line => line.trim());
[553]       
[554]       let recovered = 0;
[555]       let errors = 0;
[556]       
[557]       for (const line of lines) {
[558]         try {
[559]           const { k, v, t } = JSON.parse(line);
[560]           this.memTable.insert(k, { value: v, timestamp: t });
[561]           recovered++;
[562]         } catch (e) {
[563]           console.error("Error parsing WAL line:", line, e);
[564]           errors++;
[565]         }
[566]       }
[567]       
[568]       console.log(`WAL recovery complete: ${recovered} entries recovered, ${errors} errors`);
[569]     } catch (error) {
[570]       console.error('WAL recovery failed:', error);
[571]       // Don't throw - we can continue with an empty MemTable
[572]     }
[573]   }
[574] 
[575]   /**
[576]    * Load bloom filters from disk for all SSTables
[577]    * 
[578]    * Bloom filters are stored separately from SSTables for modularity.
[579]    * They're loaded into memory on startup for fast lookups.
[580]    */
[581]   private loadBloomFilters(): void {
[582]     try {
[583]       if (!fs.existsSync(BLOOM_DIR)) return;
[584]       
[585]       const bloomFiles = fs.readdirSync(BLOOM_DIR).filter(f => f.endsWith('.bloom'));
[586]       let loaded = 0;
[587]       
[588]       for (const bloomFile of bloomFiles) {
[589]         try {
[590]           const sstFilename = bloomFile.replace('.bloom', '.json');
[591]           const bloomPath = path.join(BLOOM_DIR, bloomFile);
[592]           const serialized = fs.readFileSync(bloomPath, 'utf-8');
[593]           const bloom = BloomFilter.deserialize(serialized);
[594]           this.bloomFilters.set(sstFilename, bloom);
[595]           loaded++;
[596]         } catch (error) {
[597]           console.error(`Failed to load bloom filter ${bloomFile}:`, error);
[598]         }
[599]       }
[600]       
[601]       console.log(`Loaded ${loaded} bloom filters`);
[602]     } catch (error) {
[603]       console.error('Failed to load bloom filters:', error);
[604]     }
[605]   }
[606] 
[607]   /**
[608]    * Get metadata for all SSTables on disk
[609]    * 
[610]    * @returns Array of SSTable metadata sorted by level and timestamp
[611]    */
[612]   private getSSTables(): SSTableMeta[] {
[613]     try {
[614]       if (!fs.existsSync(SST_DIR)) return [];
[615]       const files = fs.readdirSync(SST_DIR).filter(f => f.endsWith('.json'));
[616]       
[617]       return files.map(file => {
[618]         try {
[619]           const stats = fs.statSync(path.join(SST_DIR, file));
[620]           const content = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(path.join(SST_DIR, file), 'utf-8'));
[621]           return {
[622]             filename: file,
[623]             level: content.level || 0,
[624]             minKey: content.minKey,
[625]             maxKey: content.maxKey,
[626]             size: stats.size,
[627]             keyCount: content.count || 0
[628]           };
[629]         } catch (error) {
[630]           console.error(`Failed to read SSTable metadata for ${file}:`, error);
[631]           return null;
[632]         }
[633]       }).filter((meta): meta is SSTableMeta => meta !== null);
[634]     } catch (error) {
[635]       console.error('Failed to get SSTables:', error);
[636]       return [];
[637]     }
[638]   }
[639] 
[640]   /**
[641]    * Read all data from an SSTable file
[642]    * 
[643]    * @param filename - Name of the SSTable file
[644]    * @returns Array of key-value pairs
[645]    */
[646]   private async readSSTable(filename: string): Promise<{key: string, value: string | null}[]> {
[647]     try {
[648]       const compressed = await fs.promises.readFile(path.join(SST_DIR, filename));
[649]       const decompressed = await CompressionUtil.decompress(compressed);
[650]       const json: SSTableContent = JSON.parse(decompressed.toString('utf-8'));
[651]       return json.data;
[652]     } catch (error) {
[653]       console.error(`Failed to read SSTable ${filename}:`, error);
[654]       throw new Error(`SSTable read failed: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error'}`);
[655]     }
[656]   }
[657] 
[658]   /**
[659]    * Read a range of keys from an SSTable using sparse index if available
[660]    * 
[661]    * This optimizes range queries by using the sparse index to skip to
[662]    * the approximate position instead of scanning from the beginning.
[663]    * 
[664]    * @param filename - Name of the SSTable file
[665]    * @param startKey - Optional start of range
[666]    * @param endKey - Optional end of range
[667]    * @returns Filtered array of key-value pairs
[668]    */
[669]   private async readSSTableRange(
[670]     filename: string,
[671]     startKey?: string,
[672]     endKey?: string
[673]   ): Promise<{key: string, value: string | null}[]> {
[674]     try {
[675]       const compressed = await fs.promises.readFile(path.join(SST_DIR, filename));
[676]       const decompressed = await CompressionUtil.decompress(compressed);
[677]       const json: SSTableContent = JSON.parse(decompressed.toString('utf-8'));
[678]       
[679]       // If sparse index exists and we have a startKey, use it to find starting position
[680]       let startOffset = 0;
[681]       if (json.sparseIndex && startKey) {
[682]         // Binary search in sparse index to find nearest entry
[683]         const idx = json.sparseIndex.findIndex(entry => entry.key >= startKey);
[684]         if (idx > 0) {
[685]           startOffset = json.sparseIndex[idx - 1].offset;
[686]         }
[687]       }
[688]       
[689]       // Filter data based on range
[690]       const data = json.data.slice(startOffset);
[691]       return data.filter(entry => {
[692]         if (startKey && entry.key < startKey) return false;
[693]         if (endKey && entry.key > endKey) return false;
[694]         return true;
[695]       });
[696]     } catch (error) {
[697]       console.error(`Failed to read SSTable range ${filename}:`, error);
[698]       return [];
[699]     }
[700]   }
[701] 
[702]   /**
[703]    * Check if MemTable has reached threshold and needs flushing
[704]    */
[705]   private async checkMemTableSize(): Promise<void> {
[706]     if (this.memTable.getSize() >= MEMTABLE_THRESHOLD) {
[707]       await this.flushMemTable();
[708]       
[709]       // Trigger background compaction if needed
[710]       this.triggerCompactionIfNeeded();
[711]     }
[712]   }
[713] 
[714]   /**
[715]    * Flush MemTable to disk as a new Level 0 SSTable
[716]    * 
[717]    * This converts the in-memory MemTable into a persistent SSTable file.
[718]    * Also creates a bloom filter and sparse index for the new SSTable.
[719]    * 
[720]    * Level 0 SSTables may have overlapping key ranges since they're just
[721]    * snapshots of the MemTable at flush time.
[722]    */
[723]   private async flushMemTable(): Promise<void> {
[724]     const start = performance.now();
[725]     console.log("Flushing MemTable to SSTable...");
[726]     
[727]     try {
[728]       // Skip List maintains sorted order, so no need to sort!
[729]       // This is a major performance improvement over Map
[730]       const sortedEntries = this.memTable.toArray()
[731]         .map(([key, entry]) => ({ key, value: entry.value }));
[732] 
[733]       if (sortedEntries.length === 0) {
[734]         console.log("MemTable is empty, skipping flush");
[735]         return;
[736]       }
[737] 
[738]       const filename = `level_0_${Date.now()}.json`;
[739]       const filepath = path.join(SST_DIR, filename);
[740] 
[741]       // Create sparse index: every Nth key gets an index entry
[742]       const sparseIndex: SparseIndexEntry[] = [];
[743]       for (let i = 0; i < sortedEntries.length; i += SPARSE_INDEX_INTERVAL) {
[744]         sparseIndex.push({
[745]           key: sortedEntries[i].key,
[746]           offset: i
[747]         });
[748]       }
[749] 
[750]       // Build SSTable content
[751]       const sstContent: SSTableContent = {
[752]         level: 0,
[753]         minKey: sortedEntries[0].key,
[754]         maxKey: sortedEntries[sortedEntries.length - 1].key,
[755]         count: sortedEntries.length,
[756]         data: sortedEntries,
[757]         sparseIndex
[758]       };
[759] 
[760]       // Compress SSTable data for storage efficiency
[761]       const compressedData = await CompressionUtil.compressWithStats(JSON.stringify(sstContent));
[762]       await fs.promises.writeFile(filepath, compressedData.compressed);
[763]       
[764]       console.log(`  Compression: ${sortedEntries.length} keys, ` +
[765]                   `ratio ${compressedData.compressionRatio.toFixed(2)}x, ` +
[766]                   `saved ${compressedData.savingsPercent.toFixed(1)}%`);
[767] 
[768]       // Create and save bloom filter
[769]       const bloom = new BloomFilter(sortedEntries.length, 0.01);
[770]       for (const entry of sortedEntries) {
[771]         bloom.add(entry.key);
[772]       }
[773]       this.bloomFilters.set(filename, bloom);
[774]       
[775]       const bloomPath = path.join(BLOOM_DIR, filename.replace('.json', '.bloom'));
[776]       await fs.promises.writeFile(bloomPath, bloom.serialize());
[777] 
[778]       // Clear MemTable and WAL
[779]       this.memTable.clear();
[780]       await fs.promises.writeFile(WAL_PATH, '');
[781]       
[782]       this.lastFlushDuration = performance.now() - start;
[783]       console.log(`Flushed ${sortedEntries.length} entries to ${filename} in ${this.lastFlushDuration.toFixed(2)}ms`);
[784]     } catch (error) {
[785]       console.error('MemTable flush failed:', error);
[786]       throw new Error(`Flush operation failed: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error'}`);
[787]     }
[788]   }
[789] 
[790]   /**
[791]    * Check if compaction should be triggered and start it in the background
[792]    * 
[793]    * Compaction is triggered when:
[794]    * - Level 0 has too many files (causes read amplification)
[795]    * - Any level exceeds its size limit
[796]    */
[797]   private triggerCompactionIfNeeded(): void {
[798]     if (this.isCompacting) return;
[799] 
[800]     const sstables = this.getSSTables();
[801]     const level0Files = sstables.filter(s => s.level === 0);
[802] 
[803]     // Check if Level 0 needs compaction
[804]     if (level0Files.length >= LEVEL_0_COMPACTION_THRESHOLD) {
[805]       console.log(`Level 0 has ${level0Files.length} files, triggering compaction`);
[806]       this.compact().catch(err => console.error('Background compaction failed:', err));
[807]       return;
[808]     }
[809] 
[810]     // Check if any other level needs compaction
[811]     for (let level = 1; level < 10; level++) {
[812]       const levelFiles = sstables.filter(s => s.level === level);
[813]       const levelSize = levelFiles.reduce((sum, f) => sum + f.size, 0) / 1024; // KB
[814]       const maxSize = BASE_LEVEL_SIZE * Math.pow(LEVEL_SIZE_MULTIPLIER, level - 1);
[815] 
[816]       if (levelSize > maxSize) {
[817]         console.log(`Level ${level} size ${levelSize.toFixed(2)}KB exceeds limit ${maxSize}KB, triggering compaction`);
[818]         this.compactLevel(level).catch(err => console.error('Background compaction failed:', err));
[819]         break;
[820]       }
[821]     }
[822]   }
[823] 
[824]   // ============================================================================
[825]   // COMPACTION METHODS
[826]   // ============================================================================
[827] 
[828]   /**
[829]    * Compact Level 0 SSTables into Level 1
[830]    * 
[831]    * Level 0 is special: files can have overlapping key ranges.
[832]    * This method merges all L0 files into L1, resolving conflicts
[833]    * and removing tombstones.
[834]    * 
[835]    * Compaction process:
[836]    * 1. Read all L0 SSTables (sorted by timestamp, oldest first)
[837]    * 2. Merge entries, keeping most recent value for each key
[838]    * 3. Remove tombstones (deleted keys)
[839]    * 4. Write merged data to new L1 SSTable
[840]    * 5. Delete old L0 files
[841]    * 
[842]    * Write amplification = (bytes read + bytes written) / bytes written
[843]    */
[844]   public async compact(): Promise<void> {
[845]     if (this.isCompacting) {
[846]       console.log('Compaction already in progress');
[847]       return;
[848]     }
[849]     
[850]     const start = performance.now();
[851]     this.isCompacting = true;
[852]     
[853]     try {
[854]       const sstables = this.getSSTables();
[855]       const level0 = sstables.filter(s => s.level === 0);
[856]       
[857]       if (level0.length < 2) {
[858]         console.log('Not enough L0 files to compact');
[859]         return;
[860]       }
[861] 
[862]       console.log(`Starting compaction of ${level0.length} Level 0 files`);
[863] 
[864]       // Merge all L0 files, keeping most recent value for each key
[865]       const allData = new Map<string, string | null>();
[866]       
[867]       // Sort by timestamp (oldest first) so newer writes override older ones
[868]       level0.sort((a, b) => {
[869]         const timeA = parseInt(a.filename.split('_')[2]);
[870]         const timeB = parseInt(b.filename.split('_')[2]);
[871]         return timeA - timeB;
[872]       });
[873] 
[874]       let totalBytesRead = 0;
[875]       for (const sst of level0) {
[876]         totalBytesRead += sst.size;
[877]         const data = await this.readSSTable(sst.filename);
[878]         for (const entry of data) {
[879]           allData.set(entry.key, entry.value); // Later writes override
[880]         }
[881]       }
[882] 
[883]       // Remove tombstones and sort by key
[884]       const finalData = Array.from(allData.entries())
[885]         .filter(([_, value]) => value !== null) // Remove deleted keys
[886]         .sort((a, b) => a[0].localeCompare(b[0]))
[887]         .map(([key, value]) => ({ key, value: value! }));
[888] 
[889]       if (finalData.length === 0) {
[890]         console.log('All data was deleted, removing L0 files');
[891]         // Just delete the L0 files, no need to create empty L1
[892]         for (const sst of level0) {
[893]           await this.deleteSSTable(sst.filename);
[894]         }
[895]         return;
[896]       }
[897] 
[898]       // Create new Level 1 SSTable with sparse index
[899]       const filename = `level_1_${Date.now()}.json`;
[900]       const filepath = path.join(SST_DIR, filename);
[901] 
[902]       const sparseIndex: SparseIndexEntry[] = [];
[903]       for (let i = 0; i < finalData.length; i += SPARSE_INDEX_INTERVAL) {
[904]         sparseIndex.push({
[905]           key: finalData[i].key,
[906]           offset: i
[907]         });
[908]       }
[909] 
[910]       const content: SSTableContent = {
[911]         level: 1,
[912]         minKey: finalData[0].key,
[913]         maxKey: finalData[finalData.length - 1].key,
[914]         count: finalData.length,
[915]         data: finalData,
[916]         sparseIndex
[917]       };
[918] 
[919]       const contentStr = JSON.stringify(content);
[920]       await fs.promises.writeFile(filepath, contentStr);
[921] 
[922]       // Create bloom filter for new SSTable
[923]       const bloom = new BloomFilter(finalData.length, 0.01);
[924]       for (const entry of finalData) {
[925]         bloom.add(entry.key);
[926]       }
[927]       this.bloomFilters.set(filename, bloom);
[928]       
[929]       const bloomPath = path.join(BLOOM_DIR, filename.replace('.json', '.bloom'));
[930]       await fs.promises.writeFile(bloomPath, bloom.serialize());
[931] 
[932]       // Calculate write amplification
[933]       this.writeAmplification = (totalBytesRead + contentStr.length) / (contentStr.length || 1);
[934] 
[935]       // Delete old L0 files
[936]       for (const sst of level0) {
[937]         await this.deleteSSTable(sst.filename);
[938]       }
[939] 
[940]       this.lastCompactionDuration = performance.now() - start;
[941]       console.log(`Compaction complete: merged ${level0.length} files into ${filename}`);
[942]       console.log(`  - Keys: ${finalData.length}, Write amplification: ${this.writeAmplification.toFixed(2)}x`);
[943]       console.log(`  - Duration: ${this.lastCompactionDuration.toFixed(2)}ms`);
[944]     } catch (error) {
[945]       console.error('Compaction failed:', error);
[946]       throw new Error(`Compaction failed: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error'}`);
[947]     } finally {
[948]       this.isCompacting = false;
[949]     }
[950]   }
[951] 
[952]   /**
[953]    * Compact a specific level to the next level
[954]    * 
[955]    * For Level N â†’ Level N+1 compaction:
[956]    * 1. Select SSTables from level N that need compaction
[957]    * 2. Find overlapping SSTables in level N+1
[958]    * 3. Merge them together, removing duplicates and tombstones
[959]    * 4. Write new SSTables to level N+1
[960]    * 5. Delete old SSTables from both levels
[961]    * 
[962]    * @param level - The level to compact (must be >= 1)
[963]    */
[964]   private async compactLevel(level: number): Promise<void> {
[965]     if (this.isCompacting || level < 1) return;
[966]     
[967]     const start = performance.now();
[968]     this.isCompacting = true;
[969]     
[970]     try {
[971]       console.log(`Starting compaction of Level ${level} to Level ${level + 1}`);
[972]       
[973]       const sstables = this.getSSTables();
[974]       const currentLevelFiles = sstables.filter(s => s.level === level);
[975]       const nextLevelFiles = sstables.filter(s => s.level === level + 1);
[976] 
[977]       if (currentLevelFiles.length === 0) {
[978]         console.log(`No files at Level ${level}`);
[979]         return;
[980]       }
[981] 
[982]       // For simplicity, compact all files at this level
[983]       // In a production system, you'd select a subset based on overlapping ranges
[984]       const filesToCompact = currentLevelFiles;
[985] 
[986]       // Find overlapping files in next level
[987]       const minKeyStr = filesToCompact.reduce((min, f) => f.minKey < min ? f.minKey : min, filesToCompact[0].minKey);
[988]       const maxKeyStr = filesToCompact.reduce((max, f) => f.maxKey > max ? f.maxKey : max, filesToCompact[0].maxKey);
[989]       const overlappingNextLevel = nextLevelFiles.filter(f => 
[990]         !(f.maxKey < minKeyStr || f.minKey > maxKeyStr)
[991]       );
[992] 
[993]       // Merge all selected files
[994]       const allFiles = [...filesToCompact, ...overlappingNextLevel];
[995]       const mergedData = new Map<string, string | null>();
[996]       let totalBytesRead = 0;
[997] 
[998]       for (const sst of allFiles) {
[999]         totalBytesRead += sst.size;
[1000]         const data = await this.readSSTable(sst.filename);
[1001]         for (const entry of data) {
[1002]           if (!mergedData.has(entry.key)) {
[1003]             mergedData.set(entry.key, entry.value);
[1004]           }
[1005]         }
[1006]       }
[1007] 
[1008]       // Remove tombstones and sort
[1009]       const finalData = Array.from(mergedData.entries())
[1010]         .filter(([_, value]) => value !== null)
[1011]         .sort((a, b) => a[0].localeCompare(b[0]))
[1012]         .map(([key, value]) => ({ key, value: value! }));
[1013] 
[1014]       if (finalData.length === 0) {
[1015]         console.log('All data was deleted');
[1016]         for (const sst of allFiles) {
[1017]           await this.deleteSSTable(sst.filename);
[1018]         }
[1019]         return;
[1020]       }
[1021] 
[1022]       // Write new SSTable at next level
[1023]       const filename = `level_${level + 1}_${Date.now()}.json`;
[1024]       
[1025]       const sparseIndex: SparseIndexEntry[] = [];
[1026]       for (let i = 0; i < finalData.length; i += SPARSE_INDEX_INTERVAL) {
[1027]         sparseIndex.push({ key: finalData[i].key, offset: i });
[1028]       }
[1029] 
[1030]       const content: SSTableContent = {
[1031]         level: level + 1,
[1032]         minKey: finalData[0].key,
[1033]         maxKey: finalData[finalData.length - 1].key,
[1034]         count: finalData.length,
[1035]         data: finalData,
[1036]         sparseIndex
[1037]       };
[1038] 
[1039]       await fs.promises.writeFile(path.join(SST_DIR, filename), JSON.stringify(content));
[1040] 
[1041]       // Create bloom filter
[1042]       const bloom = new BloomFilter(finalData.length, 0.01);
[1043]       for (const entry of finalData) {
[1044]         bloom.add(entry.key);
[1045]       }
[1046]       this.bloomFilters.set(filename, bloom);
[1047]       await fs.promises.writeFile(
[1048]         path.join(BLOOM_DIR, filename.replace('.json', '.bloom')),
[1049]         bloom.serialize()
[1050]       );
[1051] 
[1052]       // Delete old files
[1053]       for (const sst of allFiles) {
[1054]         await this.deleteSSTable(sst.filename);
[1055]       }
[1056] 
[1057]       this.lastCompactionDuration = performance.now() - start;
[1058]       console.log(`Level ${level} compaction complete in ${this.lastCompactionDuration.toFixed(2)}ms`);
[1059]     } catch (error) {
[1060]       console.error(`Level ${level} compaction failed:`, error);
[1061]     } finally {
[1062]       this.isCompacting = false;
[1063]     }
[1064]   }
[1065] 
[1066]   /**
[1067]    * Delete an SSTable and its associated bloom filter
[1068]    */
[1069]   private async deleteSSTable(filename: string): Promise<void> {
[1070]     try {
[1071]       // Delete SSTable file
[1072]       const sstPath = path.join(SST_DIR, filename);
[1073]       if (fs.existsSync(sstPath)) {
[1074]         await fs.promises.unlink(sstPath);
[1075]       }
[1076] 
[1077]       // Delete bloom filter
[1078]       const bloomPath = path.join(BLOOM_DIR, filename.replace('.json', '.bloom'));
[1079]       if (fs.existsSync(bloomPath)) {
[1080]         await fs.promises.unlink(bloomPath);
[1081]       }
[1082] 
[1083]       // Remove from memory
[1084]       this.bloomFilters.delete(filename);
[1085]     } catch (error) {
[1086]       console.error(`Failed to delete SSTable ${filename}:`, error);
[1087]     }
[1088]   }
[1089] 
[1090]   /**
[1091]    * Public method to get SSTable count (for compaction worker)
[1092]    */
[1093]   public getSSTableCount(): number {
[1094]     try {
[1095]       const files = fs.readdirSync(SST_DIR);
[1096]       return files.filter(f => f.endsWith('.json')).length;
[1097]     } catch {
[1098]       return 0;
[1099]     }
[1100]   }
[1101] 
[1102]   /**
[1103]    * Public method to trigger compaction (for compaction worker)
[1104]    */
[1105]   public async performCompaction(level: number = 0): Promise<void> {
[1106]     if (this.isCompacting) {
[1107]       console.log('Compaction already in progress, skipping');
[1108]       return;
[1109]     }
[1110]     
[1111]     const start = performance.now();
[1112]     await this.compact();
[1113]     const duration = performance.now() - start;
[1114]     
[1115]     metrics.recordCompaction(duration);
[1116]     console.log(`Compaction completed in ${duration.toFixed(2)}ms`);
[1117]   }
[1118] 
[1119]   /**
[1120]    * Stop the background compaction worker (for cleanup)
[1121]    */
[1122]   public stop(): void {
[1123]     if (this.compactionWorker) {
[1124]       this.compactionWorker.stop();
[1125]     }
[1126]     console.log('LSM Tree stopped');
[1127]   }
[1128] 
[1129]   /**
[1130]    * Get metrics snapshot (for HTTP endpoint)
[1131]    */
[1132]   public getMetricsSnapshot() {
[1133]     return metrics.getSnapshot();
[1134]   }
[1135] }
[1136] 
[1137] export const lsm = new LSMTree();

### FILE: server/metrics.ts (added)
[1] /**
[2]  * Performance Metrics System
[3]  * 
[4]  * Tracks operation latencies and calculates percentiles (P50, P95, P99)
[5]  * Provides real-time performance monitoring and observability
[6]  * 
[7]  * Features:
[8]  * - Rolling window histogram (configurable size)
[9]  * - Efficient percentile calculation
[10]  * - Per-operation type tracking
[11]  * - Export to JSON for monitoring dashboards
[12]  */
[13] 
[14] export interface PercentileMetrics {
[15]   count: number;
[16]   min: number;
[17]   max: number;
[18]   mean: number;
[19]   p50: number;
[20]   p95: number;
[21]   p99: number;
[22] }
[23] 
[24] export interface MetricsSnapshot {
[25]   timestamp: number;
[26]   uptime: number;
[27]   operations: {
[28]     get: PercentileMetrics;
[29]     put: PercentileMetrics;
[30]     delete: PercentileMetrics;
[31]     scan: PercentileMetrics;
[32]   };
[33]   compaction: {
[34]     totalCompactions: number;
[35]     avgDuration: number;
[36]     lastCompaction?: number;
[37]   };
[38]   storage: {
[39]     memTableSize: number;
[40]     sstableCount: number;
[41]     bloomFilterHitRate?: number;
[42]   };
[43] }
[44] 
[45] /**
[46]  * Histogram for tracking latency distribution
[47]  */
[48] class Histogram {
[49]   private latencies: number[] = [];
[50]   private maxSize: number;
[51] 
[52]   constructor(maxSize: number = 10_000) {
[53]     this.maxSize = maxSize;
[54]   }
[55] 
[56]   /**
[57]    * Record a latency measurement
[58]    */
[59]   record(latencyMs: number): void {
[60]     this.latencies.push(latencyMs);
[61]     
[62]     // Keep only the most recent measurements
[63]     if (this.latencies.length > this.maxSize) {
[64]       this.latencies.shift();
[65]     }
[66]   }
[67] 
[68]   /**
[69]    * Calculate percentile metrics
[70]    */
[71]   getMetrics(): PercentileMetrics {
[72]     if (this.latencies.length === 0) {
[73]       return {
[74]         count: 0,
[75]         min: 0,
[76]         max: 0,
[77]         mean: 0,
[78]         p50: 0,
[79]         p95: 0,
[80]         p99: 0,
[81]       };
[82]     }
[83] 
[84]     const sorted = [...this.latencies].sort((a, b) => a - b);
[85]     const count = sorted.length;
[86]     const sum = sorted.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0);
[87] 
[88]     return {
[89]       count,
[90]       min: sorted[0],
[91]       max: sorted[count - 1],
[92]       mean: sum / count,
[93]       p50: this.percentile(sorted, 0.5),
[94]       p95: this.percentile(sorted, 0.95),
[95]       p99: this.percentile(sorted, 0.99),
[96]     };
[97]   }
[98] 
[99]   /**
[100]    * Calculate specific percentile from sorted array
[101]    */
[102]   private percentile(sorted: number[], p: number): number {
[103]     const index = Math.ceil(sorted.length * p) - 1;
[104]     return sorted[Math.max(0, index)];
[105]   }
[106] 
[107]   /**
[108]    * Reset all measurements
[109]    */
[110]   reset(): void {
[111]     this.latencies = [];
[112]   }
[113] 
[114]   /**
[115]    * Get raw latency data
[116]    */
[117]   getRawData(): number[] {
[118]     return [...this.latencies];
[119]   }
[120] }
[121] 
[122] /**
[123]  * Main metrics collector
[124]  */
[125] export class MetricsCollector {
[126]   private startTime = Date.now();
[127]   private histograms = {
[128]     get: new Histogram(),
[129]     put: new Histogram(),
[130]     delete: new Histogram(),
[131]     scan: new Histogram(),
[132]     batch: new Histogram(),
[133]   };
[134] 
[135]   private compactionMetrics = {
[136]     count: 0,
[137]     totalDuration: 0,
[138]     lastCompaction: 0,
[139]   };
[140] 
[141]   private storageMetrics = {
[142]     memTableSize: 0,
[143]     sstableCount: 0,
[144]     bloomFilterHits: 0,
[145]     bloomFilterMisses: 0,
[146]   };
[147] 
[148]   /**
[149]    * Record a GET operation latency
[150]    */
[151]   recordGet(latencyMs: number): void {
[152]     this.histograms.get.record(latencyMs);
[153]   }
[154] 
[155]   /**
[156]    * Record a PUT operation latency
[157]    */
[158]   recordPut(latencyMs: number): void {
[159]     this.histograms.put.record(latencyMs);
[160]   }
[161] 
[162]   /**
[163]    * Record a DELETE operation latency
[164]    */
[165]   recordDelete(latencyMs: number): void {
[166]     this.histograms.delete.record(latencyMs);
[167]   }
[168] 
[169]   /**
[170]    * Record a SCAN operation latency
[171]    */
[172]   recordScan(latencyMs: number): void {
[173]     this.histograms.scan.record(latencyMs);
[174]   }
[175] 
[176]   /**
[177]    * Record a batch PUT operation latency
[178]    */
[179]   recordBatchPut(latencyMs: number, operationCount: number): void {
[180]     this.histograms.batch.record(latencyMs);
[181]     // Also count individual operations for write count
[182]     for (let i = 0; i < operationCount; i++) {
[183]       this.histograms.put.record(latencyMs / operationCount);
[184]     }
[185]   }
[186] 
[187]   /**
[188]    * Record a batch DELETE operation latency
[189]    */
[190]   recordBatchDelete(latencyMs: number, operationCount: number): void {
[191]     this.histograms.batch.record(latencyMs);
[192]     // Also count individual operations for delete count
[193]     for (let i = 0; i < operationCount; i++) {
[194]       this.histograms.delete.record(latencyMs / operationCount);
[195]     }
[196]   }
[197] 
[198]   /**
[199]    * Record a compaction event
[200]    */
[201]   recordCompaction(durationMs: number): void {
[202]     this.compactionMetrics.count++;
[203]     this.compactionMetrics.totalDuration += durationMs;
[204]     this.compactionMetrics.lastCompaction = Date.now();
[205]   }
[206] 
[207]   /**
[208]    * Update storage metrics
[209]    */
[210]   updateStorage(memTableSize: number, sstableCount: number): void {
[211]     this.storageMetrics.memTableSize = memTableSize;
[212]     this.storageMetrics.sstableCount = sstableCount;
[213]   }
[214] 
[215]   /**
[216]    * Record bloom filter hit/miss
[217]    */
[218]   recordBloomFilter(hit: boolean): void {
[219]     if (hit) {
[220]       this.storageMetrics.bloomFilterHits++;
[221]     } else {
[222]       this.storageMetrics.bloomFilterMisses++;
[223]     }
[224]   }
[225] 
[226]   /**
[227]    * Get complete metrics snapshot
[228]    */
[229]   getSnapshot(): MetricsSnapshot {
[230]     const now = Date.now();
[231]     const uptime = now - this.startTime;
[232] 
[233]     const bloomTotal = this.storageMetrics.bloomFilterHits + this.storageMetrics.bloomFilterMisses;
[234]     const bloomFilterHitRate = bloomTotal > 0
[235]       ? this.storageMetrics.bloomFilterHits / bloomTotal
[236]       : undefined;
[237] 
[238]     return {
[239]       timestamp: now,
[240]       uptime,
[241]       operations: {
[242]         get: this.histograms.get.getMetrics(),
[243]         put: this.histograms.put.getMetrics(),
[244]         delete: this.histograms.delete.getMetrics(),
[245]         scan: this.histograms.scan.getMetrics(),
[246]       },
[247]       compaction: {
[248]         totalCompactions: this.compactionMetrics.count,
[249]         avgDuration:
[250]           this.compactionMetrics.count > 0
[251]             ? this.compactionMetrics.totalDuration / this.compactionMetrics.count
[252]             : 0,
[253]         lastCompaction: this.compactionMetrics.lastCompaction || undefined,
[254]       },
[255]       storage: {
[256]         memTableSize: this.storageMetrics.memTableSize,
[257]         sstableCount: this.storageMetrics.sstableCount,
[258]         bloomFilterHitRate,
[259]       },
[260]     };
[261]   }
[262] 
[263]   /**
[264]    * Export metrics as JSON string
[265]    */
[266]   exportJSON(): string {
[267]     return JSON.stringify(this.getSnapshot(), null, 2);
[268]   }
[269] 
[270]   /**
[271]    * Print metrics to console in human-readable format
[272]    */
[273]   printSummary(): void {
[274]     const snapshot = this.getSnapshot();
[275]     
[276]     console.log('\n=== LSM Tree Performance Metrics ===');
[277]     console.log(`Uptime: ${(snapshot.uptime / 1000).toFixed(1)}s`);
[278]     console.log();
[279] 
[280]     console.log('Operations:');
[281]     for (const [op, metrics] of Object.entries(snapshot.operations)) {
[282]       if (metrics.count > 0) {
[283]         console.log(`  ${op.toUpperCase()}:`);
[284]         console.log(`    Count: ${metrics.count}`);
[285]         console.log(`    Mean: ${metrics.mean.toFixed(3)}ms`);
[286]         console.log(`    P50: ${metrics.p50.toFixed(3)}ms`);
[287]         console.log(`    P95: ${metrics.p95.toFixed(3)}ms`);
[288]         console.log(`    P99: ${metrics.p99.toFixed(3)}ms`);
[289]         console.log(`    Min/Max: ${metrics.min.toFixed(3)}ms / ${metrics.max.toFixed(3)}ms`);
[290]       }
[291]     }
[292] 
[293]     console.log();
[294]     console.log('Compaction:');
[295]     console.log(`  Total: ${snapshot.compaction.totalCompactions}`);
[296]     console.log(`  Avg Duration: ${snapshot.compaction.avgDuration.toFixed(2)}ms`);
[297]     if (snapshot.compaction.lastCompaction) {
[298]       const elapsed = (Date.now() - snapshot.compaction.lastCompaction) / 1000;
[299]       console.log(`  Last: ${elapsed.toFixed(1)}s ago`);
[300]     }
[301] 
[302]     console.log();
[303]     console.log('Storage:');
[304]     console.log(`  MemTable Size: ${snapshot.storage.memTableSize}`);
[305]     console.log(`  SSTable Count: ${snapshot.storage.sstableCount}`);
[306]     if (snapshot.storage.bloomFilterHitRate !== undefined) {
[307]       console.log(`  Bloom Filter Hit Rate: ${(snapshot.storage.bloomFilterHitRate * 100).toFixed(1)}%`);
[308]     }
[309]     
[310]     console.log();
[311]   }
[312] 
[313]   /**
[314]    * Reset all metrics
[315]    */
[316]   reset(): void {
[317]     this.startTime = Date.now();
[318]     this.histograms.get.reset();
[319]     this.histograms.put.reset();
[320]     this.histograms.delete.reset();
[321]     this.histograms.scan.reset();
[322]     this.compactionMetrics = {
[323]       count: 0,
[324]       totalDuration: 0,
[325]       lastCompaction: 0,
[326]     };
[327]     this.storageMetrics = {
[328]       memTableSize: 0,
[329]       sstableCount: 0,
[330]       bloomFilterHits: 0,
[331]       bloomFilterMisses: 0,
[332]     };
[333]   }
[334] }
[335] 
[336] // Global singleton instance
[337] export const metrics = new MetricsCollector();

### FILE: server/prometheus-metrics.ts (added)
[1] import client from 'prom-client';
[2] 
[3] // Create register
[4] export const register = new client.Registry();
[5] 
[6] // Histogram metrics
[7] export const writeLatency = new client.Histogram({
[8]   name: 'lsm_write_latency_ms',
[9]   help: 'Write operation latency in milliseconds',
[10]   buckets: [0.1, 0.5, 1, 2, 5, 10, 50, 100],
[11]   registers: [register]
[12] });
[13] 
[14] export const readLatency = new client.Histogram({
[15]   name: 'lsm_read_latency_ms',
[16]   help: 'Read operation latency in milliseconds',
[17]   buckets: [0.1, 0.5, 1, 2, 5, 10, 50, 100],
[18]   registers: [register]
[19] });
[20] 
[21] export const deleteLatency = new client.Histogram({
[22]   name: 'lsm_delete_latency_ms',
[23]   help: 'Delete operation latency in milliseconds',
[24]   buckets: [0.1, 0.5, 1, 2, 5, 10, 50, 100],
[25]   registers: [register]
[26] });
[27] 
[28] export const scanLatency = new client.Histogram({
[29]   name: 'lsm_scan_latency_ms',
[30]   help: 'Scan operation latency in milliseconds',
[31]   buckets: [1, 5, 10, 50, 100, 500],
[32]   registers: [register]
[33] });

[36]   name: 'lsm_batch_latency_ms',

[38]   buckets: [1, 5, 10, 50, 100, 500],
[39]   registers: [register]
[40] });

[46]   registers: [register]
[47] });
[48]

[50]   name: 'lsm_read_total',
[51]   help: 'Total read operations',
[52]   registers: [register]
[53] });

[57]   help: 'Total delete operations',

[59] });
[60]

[66]

[72]

[75]   help: 'Total compaction operations',
[76]   registers: [register]
[77] });
[78] 
[79] export const walWriteCount = new client.Counter({

[81]   help: 'Total WAL writes',

[116] export const compactionInProgress = new client.Gauge({
